page.title: 20CHANGING TIMES
page.content: Dornoch was still the commercial and business centre of the area in 1953. There were 30 shops and 6 hotels. The population in the burgh was 788. Now it is around 900. Agriculture employed many people and there was hardly any unemployment. The town council led by the Provest looked after Dornoch's affairs. Some older people still spoke Gaelic. Most people were church goers. Dornoch Academy was a primary and 6 year secondary school, with a roll of 300 pupils. These were local pupils and boarders from the North and West. Now the school is a two year secondary with 240 pupis. The coronation was celebrated by sport in meadows Park. Each child received a New Testament, coronation mug and a pencil. Not so many people had cars. Dornoch station was still open and on this branch line were 2 trains daily to the Mound.
